User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments – some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player. 

AI:## Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...)
2. PlayerAttribute (name, value)

## Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
2. HeadCoach
3. Director
4. Scout
5. Player
6. ScoutingAssignment
7. ScoutingReport
8. ShortList
9. OfficialOffer

## Attributes:
### TeamSportsScoutingSystem:
- List\<HeadCoach\> headCoaches
- List\<Director\> directors
- List\<Scout\> scouts
- List\<Player\> designatedPlayerProfiles
- List\<ShortList\> shortLists

### HeadCoach:
- List\<PlayerPosition\> designatedTargetPositions

### Scout:
- List\<Player\> longList
- List\<ScoutingAssignment\> scoutingAssignments

### Player:
- String name
- List\<PlayerAttribute\> attributes

### ScoutingAssignment:
- Player player
- List\<ScoutingReport\> scoutingReports

### ScoutingReport:
- String pros
- String cons
- String recommendation

### ShortList:
- List\<Player\> players

### OfficialOffer:
- Player player

...
Classes:

2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...): Represents the different designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerAttribute (name, value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by a name and a value.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(headCoaches: List<HeadCoach>, directors: List<Director>, scouts: List<Scout>, designatedPlayerProfiles: List<Player>, shortLists: List<ShortList>): Represents the main system used by the club for scouting players.
2. HeadCoach(designatedTargetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director: Represents the director of the club who makes official offers for players.
4. Scout: Represents the scout who notes players in a long list and submits scouting reports.
5. Player(name: String, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a name and attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment for a player.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: String): Represents a scouting report submitted by a scout.
8. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a short list of players identified for further evaluation.
9. OfficialOffer(player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(headCoach: HeadCoach, director: Director, scouts: List<Scout>, shortLists: List<ShortList>): Represents the main system used by the club's employees for scouting players.
2. Employee(name: String): Represents a generic employee in the club.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach of the club responsible for identifying player profiles.
4. Director: Represents the director of the club.
5. Scout: Represents a scout in the club.
6. Player(name: String, attributes: Map<String, String>): Represents a player with various attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents an assignment given to a scout to scout a player.
8. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents the report submitted by a scout about a player.
9. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a list of players shortlisted for further evaluation.
10. OfficialOffer(player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments – some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player. 

AI:## Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - CB (Center Back)
   - RB (Right Back)
   - CDM (Central Defensive Midfielder)
   - CM (Central Midfielder)
   - CAM (Attacking Midfielder)
   - RW (Right Winger)
   - LW (Left Winger)
   - CF (Center Forward)
   
2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

## Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - Role
   
2. HeadCoach
   - Inherits from Employee
   - Attributes:
     - DesignatedPlayerProfiles (List of designated player profiles)
   
3. Director
   - Inherits from Employee
   - Attributes:
     - ShortListedPlayers (List of short-listed players)
   
4. Scout
   - Inherits from Employee
   - Attributes:
     - LongListedPlayers (List of long-listed players)
     - ScoutingAssignments (List of scouting assignments)
     - ScoutingReports (List of scouting reports)
   
5. Player
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Position (PlayerPosition)
     - Attributes (List of name-value pairs for player attributes)

6. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - Scout
     - Completed
   
7. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)
   
8. Offer
   - Attributes:
     - Player
     - Director

## Note:
- This class model is a basic representation of the given description and may require further refinement based on additional requirements or constraints.

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, CB, RB, CDM, CM, CAM, RW, LW, CF): Represents different positions a player can play in, aiding in player profiling.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing): Indicates the recommendation status of a player for signing.

Classes:
1. Employee(Role: String): Represents a generic employee with a role in the club.
2. HeadCoach(Role: String, DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach with designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(Role: String, ShortListedPlayers: List<Player>): Represents the director with a list of short-listed players for evaluation.
4. Scout(Role: String, LongListedPlayers: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>, ScoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a scout with long-listed players, scouting assignments, and scouting reports.
5. Player(Name: String, Position: PlayerPosition, Attributes: List<Attribute>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(Player: Player, Scout: Scout, Completed: Boolean): Represents a scouting assignment linking a player and a scout.
7. ScoutingReport(Player: Player, Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report with player evaluation and recommendation.
8. Offer(Player: Player, Director: Director): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(headCoach: Employee, clubDirector: Employee, scouts: List<Employee>, headScout: Employee): Represents the system used by club employees for player scouting and recruitment.
2. Employee(name: String, role: String): Represents an employee in the club with a name and role.
3. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, otherAttributes: Map<String, PlayerAttribute>): Describes the profile of a player including target positions and other attributes.
4. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: Map<String, PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes.
5. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, scout: Employee, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents an assignment for a scout to evaluate a player and submit a scouting report.
6. ScoutingReport(pros: List<String>, cons: List<String>, recommendation: ScoutingRecommendation): Contains the pros, cons, and recommendation for a player based on scouting.
7. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a list of players selected for further evaluation.
8. ScoutingRound(shortList: ShortList, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a round of scouting with a short-list and assignments.
9. OfficialOffer(player: Player, director: Employee): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

3. Recommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ...): Represents the recommendations for a player after scouting.

### Classes:
1. Employee(role: Role): Represents an employee of the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles.
3. Director: Represents the director of the club who can make offers for players.
4. Scout(scoutingList: List, evaluateScoutingList(), submitScoutingReport()): Represents a scout who maintains a scouting list and submits scouting reports.
5. Player(attributes: List, scoutingAssignments: List): Represents a player with attributes and scouting assignments.
6. ScoutingAssignment(scoutingRounds: List): Represents a scouting assignment with multiple rounds of scouting.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: List, cons: List, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report with player evaluation and recommendation.
8. ShortList(players: List): Represents a shortlist of players selected for further evaluation.

2. PlayerAttribute(name, value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by name and value.
3. Recommendation(KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ReserveTeamPlayer, ProspectivePlayer, NotAGoodSigning): Represents the recommendations for a player based on scouting reports.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(): Represents the overall system used by the club's employees for scouting players.
2. Employee(role): Represents an employee in the club with a specific role.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
4. Director(): Represents the director who makes official offers for players.
5. Scout(longList, scoutingAssignments): Represents a scout who notes players, evaluates long lists, and submits scouting reports.
6. ScoutingAssignment(player): Represents a scouting assignment for a specific player.
7. ScoutingReport(pros, cons, recommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation for a player.
8. ShortList(): Represents a short list of players selected for further scouting.
9. Player(scoutingResults): Represents a player with scouting results from multiple rounds.
10. HeadScout(): Represents the head scout who sets scouting assignments.
11. Offer(): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments – some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player. 

AI:## Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...
   
2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

## Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - Name: String
     - Role: String

2. PlayerAttribute
   - Attributes:
     - Name: String
     - Value: String

3. PlayerProfile
   - Attributes:
     - TargetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>
     - OtherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>

4. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - Scout: Employee
     - Player: PlayerProfile
     - Evaluation: String

5. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - Player: PlayerProfile
     - Pros: String
     - Cons: String
     - Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation

6. ShortListedPlayer
   - Attributes:
     - Player: PlayerProfile

7. ScoutingRound
   - Attributes:
     - RoundNumber: int
     - Players: List<ShortListedPlayer>

8. OfficialOffer
   - Attributes:
     - Player: PlayerProfile
     - Director: Employee

## Attributes:
- Employee:
  - Name: String
  - Role: String

- PlayerAttribute:
  - Name: String
  - Value: String

- PlayerProfile:
  - TargetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>

- ScoutingAssignment:
  - Scout: Employee
  - Player: PlayerProfile

  - Pros: String
  - Cons: String
  - Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation

- ScoutingRound:
  - RoundNumber: int
  - Players: List<ShortListedPlayer>

- OfficialOffer:
  - Player: PlayerProfile
  - Director: Employee

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...): Represents designated target positions for a player to be scouted.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, ...): Represents recommendations for a player based on scouting evaluation.

Classes:
1. Employee(Name: String, Role: String): Represents an employee of the club with a name and role.
2. PlayerAttribute(Name: String, Value: String): Represents an attribute of a player identified by a name and value.
3. PlayerProfile(TargetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, OtherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute): Represents a player profile with target positions and other attributes.
4. ScoutingAssignment(Scout: Employee, Player: PlayerProfile, Evaluation: String): Represents a scouting assignment conducted by a scout for a player.
5. ScoutingReport(Player: PlayerProfile, Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report for a player with pros, cons, and recommendation.
6. ShortListedPlayer(Player: PlayerProfile): Represents a player who has been shortlisted for further scouting.
7. ScoutingRound(RoundNumber: int, Players: List<ShortListedPlayer>): Represents a round of scouting with a round number and list of shortlisted players.
8. OfficialOffer(Player: PlayerProfile, Director: Employee): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for a player to be scouted for.

2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, ...): Represents the recommendations provided in a scouting report for a player.

### Classes:
1. Employee(employeeId: int, name: String, role: String): Represents an employee of the club with unique ID, name, and role.

2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.

3. Scout(scoutingList: List<Player>): Represents a scout who maintains a list of players to be scouted.

4. PlayerAttribute(attributeName: String, attributeValue: String): Represents an attribute of a player identified by a name and value.

5. ScoutingAssignment(completed: boolean, assignedPlayer: Player, assignedScout: Scout, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment for a player with associated scout and report.

6. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents the report generated by a scout on a player.

7. ShortListedPlayer(player: Player, scoutingRounds: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a player who has moved to the shortlist with associated scouting rounds.

8. Director(officialOffer: Offer): Represents the director who makes an official offer for a player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Represents designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
   
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, etc.): Represents the recommendations for a player based on scouting reports.

### Classes:
1. Employee(role: string): Represents an employee in the club with a specific role.

2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: list): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.

3. Director(officialOffer: boolean): Represents the director who makes official offers for players.

4. Scout(longList: list, scoutingReport: string): Represents a scout who notes players in a long list and submits scouting reports.

5. Player(name: string, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: map): Represents a player with a name, position, and additional attributes.

6. ScoutingAssignment(scoutingRound: ScoutingRound): Represents a scouting assignment with a specific scouting round.

7. ShortList(players: list): Represents a shortlist of players selected for further evaluation.

8. ScoutingRound(scout: Scout, completionStatus: boolean): Represents a round of scouting carried out by a scout with completion status.
